formattedAddress: 684 St Nicholas Ave, New York, NY 10030, USA
adrFormatAddress: 684 St Nicholas Ave, New York, NY 10030-1000, USA

originalText.text:
**NEW PRICES**

All Fish $10
All Shrimp $11.75
Fish Sandwich $8
Fish and Chips $9
Fish Shrimp Chips $17.50
Fish Shrimp Clams $21
One Piece Fish $2.75
Soda/Water $1
Lemonade/Half-Half $2.50

Menu is hard to photograph because they have a divider up. The batter has changed from the original years ago, which was much more savory. If you like a sweeter fry, especially shrimp, you will love this place. The lemonade/ice tea/half and half is so refreshing. It‚Äôs usually busy with a little bit of a wait but they have their system down pat. The like moves very fast and I like to stand outside since it gets cramped inside.

The fried clams are delicious, I always get them extra crispy. Sometimes they leave too many chunks of breading but if I could only get one thing, definitely the clams. Crispy and crunchy, and not many places around here have fried clams. The fish, shrimp, and clams is $21. The shrimp are smaller but you get 10-12 of them. The shrimp breading is VERY SWEET. It used to come with 4-5 pieces of fish but now only 3. Still a decent deal and enough to make two meals. They are very no frills and straight forward here, don‚Äôt take it personal. I ask for less tarter and more hot sauce (DELICIOUS) sometimes they do it, sometimes they don‚Äôt. They are famous for their tartar, made in house.

Bring cash to avoid CC fee + tip generously.

originalText.text:
Go to this joint to eat the most yummy, fresh fish sandwich in the area!

I wish I took a pic of the sandwich - it was bursting with 5-6 delicately fried strips of whiting on whole wheat bread, with tartar and hot sauce on the side. Simple and delicious.

The actual store is a bit cramped, so make sure you're not in the way at any point while you're ordering or waiting for your food.

originalText.text: Outrageously good. And for that price? Wish they had some standing tables or something but There‚Äôs a park around the corner that worked in a pinch. It was such a big serving I had to go on a 30 block walk after to feel less full after ha

text.text: Outrageously good. And for that price? Wish they had some standing tables or something but There‚Äôs a park around the corner that worked in a pinch. It was such a big serving I had to go on a 30 block walk after to feel less full after ha

originalText.text: Despite its modest size, this restaurant is a hidden gem when it comes to flavor! The fried whiting is exceptionally tasty. One of the things I appreciate most is their attention to detail in packaging the food. It's always served hot, straight from the stove or fryer, ensuring that every bite is as delicious as it is intended to be. The food is so good, it's worth the extra effort ‚Äì I'd go as far as to say it's finger-licking good! Given the limited space inside, I recommend ordering in advance. Since there's no indoor waiting area, you might find yourself waiting outside, but let me assure you, it's worth it. Whether it's raining, shining, or even in extreme temperatures, their fried whiting is a must-try. This place is a testament to the fact that great things often come in small packages!
